column1: '''Valedictory Address to the University of Oxford''' refers to [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s retirement speech from the [[University of Oxford]]
column2: delivered on [[5 June]] [[1959]] in the Merton College Hall.<ref>[[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]]
column3: ''[[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide]]: Reader's Guide'' (2006)

column2: when one draft of the speech was included in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Scholar and Storyteller|J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: Scholar and Storyteller: Essays in Memoriam]]''.<ref>Mary Salu
column5: in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Scholar and Storyteller|J.R.R. Tolkien
column6: Scholar and Storyteller: Essays in Memoriam]]''</ref> Another draft was published in ''[[The Monsters and the Critics|The Monsters and the Critics and Other Essays]]'' (1983).
